data.title: Leadership
data.meta_description: Learn more about the team behind the world’s leading NoSQL cloud database.
data.text:
Matt is a proven technology executive with deep experience in successfully leading global organizations through market transitions, driving operational excellence and accelerating growth. He currently serves as Chair, President and CEO of Couchbase (NASDAQ: BASE), where his vision and leadership transformed the company, leading to its successful IPO in July 2021.

Prior to Couchbase, Matt was President of Worldwide Field Operations for Veritas Technologies, where he was responsible for global sales as well as customer success, channels, services, and support. Before that, he was Chief Product Officer for Veritas’ $2.5B business where he led strategy, product management, product marketing, engineering, support, hardware operations, and cloud delivery. Matt also previously held a variety of senior leadership positions at Symantec Corporation and Cisco Systems.

Matt holds a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from Northwestern University and a master’s degree in Business Administration from the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Scott brings more than 20 years of experience in finance, operations, product management, and general management to Couchbase. As SVP of Cloud, Growth and Business Operations, he is responsible for optimizing Couchbase’s business insights and intelligence, driving pricing and packaging strategy, and enhancing go-to-market efficiency and cloud growth strategy. Scott previously also led Couchbase’s Product team. Prior to Couchbase, he was SVP and GM of a $1.5B business at Veritas, where he spent 15 years in various positions. Before that, Scott spent eight years at Oracle serving in various finance and business operations roles. Scott holds a bachelor’s degree in Business and Finance from the University of the Pacific.

A chartered psychologist, Fidelma is the Chief People Officer at Couchbase. She is responsible for leading the People function, aligned with the company’s values and operating objectives. In this role, she leads all aspects of the People organization, including Business Partnering, Talent Acquisition, Total Rewards, Workplace, Employee Experience & Engagement and HR Operations. She was most recently Vice President of the talent and organizational development team at Zendesk where she led its global organization development, engagement, and learning teams. Fidelma began her career with Accenture’s talent management consulting practice, specializing in large-scale technology and business model transformations, and later led the People function for fintech company Realex Payments. Fidelma holds a bachelor’s degree in Psychology from Trinity College Dublin and a master’s degree in Occupational Psychology from Cardiff University.

As Chief Legal Officer, Margaret is responsible for scaling the global legal function and advising Couchbase in all aspects of its business. Margaret is a proven leader and seasoned advisor for software and SaaS companies. Most recently, she was Deputy General Counsel at Medallia where she guided the company from early start-up stage through a successful IPO. She led their transactions practice, supporting over $300 million in revenue, as well as the corporate, compliance and employment legal functions. Prior to Medallia, Margaret served as Associate General Counsel of Usablenet where she managed several critical practice areas including intellectual property, data privacy, and litigation. Before her in-house roles, Margaret was a corporate attorney at Davis Polk and Wardwell LLP. Margaret also serves on the board of Anjiro Initiative, a 501(c)(3) organization. She holds a bachelor’s degree in Biochemistry/Molecular Biology and Economics from the University of California at Berkley and a J.D. from Yale Law School.

As Senior Vice President of Engineering, Gopi is responsible for all product development and delivery at Couchbase. He came to Couchbase from Amazon Web Services (AWS), where he served as General Manager of Analytics and Observability. During his tenure at AWS, he oversaw the development of numerous cloud-native databases, notably AWS Redshift and Aurora, and was a founding member of the AWS Glue service and CloudWatch Observability initiatives. Previously, Gopi held senior technical leadership positions at IBM and Informix, leading their flagship database offerings. Gopi holds a master’s degree in Data Science and Machine Learning from UC Berkeley, and bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from Coimbatore Institute of Technology, India.

Greg is an established finance leader with more than 20 years of experience leading global growth and financial operations within the technology industry. As Chief Financial Officer at Couchbase, Greg is responsible for the overall financial governance and management of the company’s financial operations as well as management of worldwide IT and Facilities operations. Prior to Couchbase, Greg served as Senior Vice President of Finance at ServiceNow, where he led the enterprise cloud company’s financial development and was responsible for accounting, procurement, and treasury. And before ServiceNow, he held various senior executive financial positions at GE, culminating as CFO of the multi-billion dollar Healthcare IT unit. Greg is a Certified Public Accountant (inactive) and holds a bachelor’s degree in Accounting from the University of Wisconsin-Madison School of Business.

As Chief Information Officer, Julie leads both the IT and Security teams, driving the alignment of technology initiatives with the company’s strategic objectives. Julie was previously Vice President of Business Applications and IT at New Relic where she centralized and scaled the business applications function. She also spearheaded the execution of complex transformation projects, including facilitating the transition from SaaS to consumption-based models. Prior to that, Julie held technology leadership positions at Harvard Business Publishing (HBR Magazine) and start-up RichRelevance. Julie holds a B.S. in Commerce from the University of Virginia.

John brings over 25 years of experience in technology marketing leadership to Couchbase and is responsible for the strategy and execution of all marketing activities. He’s a proven leader and builder of high-performance global marketing teams that deliver exceptional results with tight alignment to revenue objectives and corporate goals. Prior to joining Couchbase, John was the CMO at Docker. Before that, he led marketing activities at Hortonworks, Gluster, and Cloudera, and he held senior marketing positions at Red Hat, MarkLogic, and Business Objects. John holds a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from the University of Texas at Austin.

Leveraging his deep product and solutions experience, Matt is responsible for Couchbase’s product and global partner strategies and corporate development in his role as SVP of Product and Partners. He drives Couchbase’s product roadmap, competitive strategy, and corporate strategy as well as the company’s worldwide partner execution including channels, technology partners, solution partners, systems integrators, and cloud service providers. Matt previously also led Couchbase’s Business Development team. Prior to Couchbase, Matt was at EMC where he built out and led one of the flash storage offerings running product management, marketing, and solutions and had also previously led the company’s Emerging Technologies Division product and portfolio strategy. Before that, Matt was at Symantec/Veritas for seven years where he held positions across business development, alliances, strategy, marketing, and product management for both the security and information management businesses. Matt’s technology career is preceded by his service as a United States Army Officer. He holds an MBA from the Harvard Business School and a bachelor’s degree in Engineering from the United States Military Academy.

As Chief Revenue Officer, Huw is responsible for driving strong growth, strategic global account planning, and sales operations. He previously served as a sales leader for Couchbase’s international business where he increased international ARR by nearly 200%. Huw has more than 20 years of experience across a range of operations, sales development, and go-to-market leadership positions in large multi-national companies such as Veritas, Symantec, and Lenovo, and hyper-growth start-ups such as Good Technology and Tanium. He holds a bachelor’s degree in business studies from the Leicester Business School, De Montfort University.

Matt is a proven technology executive with deep experience in successfully leading global organizations through market transitions, driving operational excellence and accelerating growth. He currently serves as Chair, President and CEO of Couchbase (NASDAQ: BASE), where his vision and leadership transformed the company, leading to its successful IPO in July 2021.

Prior to Couchbase, Matt was President of Worldwide Field Operations for Veritas Technologies, where he was responsible for global sales as well as customer success, channels, services, and support. Before that, he was Chief Product Officer for Veritas’ $2.5B business where he led strategy, product management, product marketing, engineering, support, hardware operations, and cloud delivery.

Matt also previously held a variety of senior leadership positions at Symantec Corporation and Cisco Systems.Matt holds a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from Northwestern University and a master’s degree in Business Administration from the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Alvina Antar is the Chief Information Officer at Okta, the leading independent identity provider. She leads a Business Technology organization focused on accelerating Okta’s success through trusted and innovative delivery of process, technology and data solutions. Prior to Okta, she spent six years as Zuora’s first ever CIO enabling business growth from $30M to $300M in revenue including a successful IPO in 2018. Alvina previously spent 17 years at Dell focused on Digital Transformation, Global Delivery, and M&A. Alvina co-founded the Silicon Valley CIO Women’s Network bringing together Bay Area’s leading CIOs to share diverse perspectives, challenges, and experiences in a supportive atmosphere. She is a member of Girls in Tech’s Board of Directors, a global nonprofit dedicated to erasing the gender gap in tech. Alvina is also on the advisory board of BUILD, a nonprofit dedicated to igniting the potential of our youth in under-resourced communities through entrepreneurship. Alvina holds a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and lives in Menlo Park, California with her husband and three children.

Ed Anderson is the founder of North Bridge Venture Partners and North Bridge Growth Equity. He raised nearly $4 billion in capital for those partnerships. For the past 35 years, Ed has provided financing and advised entrepreneurs focused on building game changing companies. He was a pioneer in the strategy of seed investing for high tech companies and has produced industry-leading returns for investors. Ed is a graduate of the University of Denver and the Columbia University Graduate School of Business. He serves on the boards of many private companies and has numerous philanthropic interests outside of North Bridge.

Carol Carpenter is the Chief Marketing Officer of Unity and brings more than 25 years of technology sector experience. Previously at VMware, she was responsible for leading all aspects of VMware’s Global Marketing organization. Carol was Vice President of Product Marketing at Google Cloud, CEO of ElasticBox (acquired by CenturyLink), and held leadership and marketing roles in technology at Trend Micro, Keynote Systems, Apple, and more. Carol loves building and scaling new products and is particularly proud of the high-performance teams she’s developed. She continues to mentor women and students via the HBS women entrepreneurship program, the Stanford alumni network, and Monte Jade. Carol holds a bachelor’s degree in Economics from Stanford University and an MBA from the Harvard Business School.

Lynn Christensen is the former Senior Vice President of Products for Workday. She has more than 30 years of experience building and leading world-class technology teams and instilling a culture of innovation. Her background in business intelligence and analytics helps companies make better decisions and lets customers gain deeper insights into their employees and customers. As a senior executive with experience across a variety of industries, Lynn’s ability to understand both technology and business issues brings a well-rounded perspective to companies looking to transform the market. Lynn holds an MBA from San Francisco State University and a bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems from Arizona State University.

Kevin Efrusy joined Accel in 2003 and focuses on software and consumer investments. Kevin was the lead investor in a number of pioneering companies including Facebook (which he sourced for Accel in 2005), Groupon (public), Couchbase, SpringSource (acquired by VMware), BBN Technologies (acquired by Raytheon), CAN Capital, and MemSQL. He also leads the firm’s Latin America initiatives, resulting in investments in Despegar, Mind Lab, Baby.com.br, and Elo7. Prior to Accel, Kevin founded Corio, a software-as-a-service pioneer that went public and was acquired by IBM in 2005. Later, he built and served as the first CEO of IronPlanet, an online marketplace for heavy equipment with annual gross sales of more than $500 million. Kevin is from the Chicago area and graduated with a bachelor’s degree in Engineering and MBA from Stanford.

Jeff Epstein is an Operating Partner in the Silicon Valley office where he leads Bessemer’s CFO Council and helps portfolio company CEOs and CFOs share best practices.

He is the former Executive Vice President and chief financial officer of Oracle, one of the world’s largest and most profitable technology companies, with a market value of over $200 billion. Prior to joining Oracle, Jeff served as the chief financial officer at several public and private companies, including DoubleClick (acquired by Google), King World Productions (acquired by CBS), and Nielsen’s Media Measurement and Information Group. Earlier in his career, he was an investment banker at The First Boston Corporation. He specializes in B2B software, marketplaces, and artificial intelligence software.

Jeff co-teaches the Lean Launchpad class at Stanford University’s Graduate School of Engineering and the CFO Leadership class at the Stanford Graduate School of Business. He serves on the boards of directors of AvePoint, Couchbase, Kaiser Permanente, Okta, and Twilio. Jeff served on the Board of Directors of Booking Holdings/Priceline for 16 years as its market value grew from $1 billion to $80 billion.

He holds an MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business, where he was an Arjay Miller Scholar, and a bachelor’s degree from Yale College, where he graduated summa cum laude, Phi Beta Kappa.

David Scott brings more than 40 years of experience in enterprise IT infrastructure to the Couchbase board. From 2001 to 2010, David served as President and Chief Executive Officer of 3PAR, Inc., a data storage company that created and defined the market for utility storage designed for service provider IT models. While President and CEO of 3PAR, David oversaw the company’s evolution from a venture backed private company to being publicly listed on the New York Stock Exchange in 2007, then finally through its acquisition by HP in 2010 for $2.4 billion. David spent the next five years as Senior Vice President and General Manager of the global HP Storage business before focusing on board work. He has previously served on the boards of Veritas, AppDynamics, and OverOps. He currently chairs the Compensation Committee at Couchbase, and is a Board Director at Cloudian, Token, M10 Networks, Nebulon, and AntemetA.

Rick Simonson is the Managing Partner of Specie Mesa L.L.C. where he serves as advisor, investor, and independent board member for portfolio companies of select private equity and venture capital firms. His expertise and focus is on portfolio companies in the technology space that are near to mid-term to an IPO or sale. Currently, Rick is on the board of directors of Electronic Arts (EA), Evercommerce (EVCM), and Cast & Crew in addition to Couchbase. For Evercommerce he wears multiple hats as investor, lead independent director, and chair of the audit committee. At Electronic Arts he currently serves on the audit committee, which he chaired from 2015-2023. He previously served as lead director from 2009-2015. At Cast & Crew, Rick is an investor and serves as chair of the audit committee. Rick also advises select private and public companies in non-board roles. At this time he works with EQT, Redwood Capital Partners, and WestWave Capital. Rick retired as EVP & CFO of Sabre Corporation in July 2018. Before joining Sabre, Rick served as CFO and President of business operations at Rearden Commerce, a venture-backed travel technology company. From 2001 to 2010 he was EVP of Nokia Corporation, including six years as CFO.
